body:
## Breaking changes

* Drop support to Ruby < 2.6 and Rails < 6.0

## What's Changed

* Create PreconditionFailed (412) exception by @bbraschi in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/302
* Adds TooManyRequests (429) exception by @bradleypriest in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/304
* Fix active job serializer railtie by @gmcgibbon in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/310
* Fix Rails 6.1 compatibility by @casperisfine in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/335
* Set frozen_string_literal: true in the generated code by @casperisfine in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/336
* Stop using the deprecated URI.parser by @casperisfine in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/338
* Fix the missed URI.parser references by @casperisfine in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/339
* Fix find_every instantiating records from symbol and string without prefix_options by @ivan05almeida in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/348
* Add support to set bearer token connection through Base class by @ivan05almeida in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/345
* Fixed multi-threading race condition issue by @marisveide in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/349
* Fixed ActiveResource::ConnectionError#to_s to return a message which … by @faultier92 in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/353
* Stop requiring the useless and deprecated core_ext/uri by @casperisfine in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/366
* Changing headers on base class doesn't change them in subclasses by @adrien-k in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/359

## New Contributors
* @bbraschi made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/302
* @maurcarvalho made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/307
* @bradleypriest made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/304
* @pilaf made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/315
* @eitoball made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/306
* @okuramasafumi made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/320
* @larouxn made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/321
* @maria-kravtsova made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/323
* @casperisfine made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/335
* @ivan05almeida made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/348
* @marisveide made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/349
* @faultier92 made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/353
* @luk4s made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/356
* @jbampton made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/357
* @filabreu made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/364
* @aclemons made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/367
* @obahareth made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/373
* @adrien-k made their first contribution in https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/359

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/rails/activeresource/compare/v5.1.1...v6.0.0

*   Improve support of Active Resource objects inside fibers.

*   Add support to Active Model Serializers.

*   Fix error when trying to parse `nil` as a JSON response.

*   Fix `exists?` to return the right value when the response code is between 200 and 206.

*   Match the log level to the HTTP response code.

*   Add `ActiveResource::Connection.logger` accessors to configure a specific logger instance for the
    connection object.

*   Add `ActiveResource::Base#element_url` method.

*   Add Active Job serialization support with Rails 6.

*   Support lazy setting of configuration options.

*   Use `UnnamedResource` when resource fails to create normally.

*   Add support to Bearer Token Authorization header to connection.

### Enhancements
-   Adds activeresource.rb so `require: 'active_resource'` is no longer needed
  in Gemfile. ([#95](https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/95), [Pedro Nascimento](https://github.com/lunks))
-   `ActiveResource::Collection` delegates all instance methods for `Array`.
  ([#101](https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/101), [printercu](https://github.com/printercu))
-   Railtie enables configuration and dev reloading of observers just like
  ActiveRecord when using Active Resource with Rails. Active Resource also now runs Active Support
  load hooks for `:active_resource`. ([#109](https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/109), [Ches Martin](https://github.com/ches))

### Fixes
-   Improvement to thread safety of headers. ([#61](https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/61), [niedfelj](https://github.com/niedfelj))
-   A `belongs_to` child with a missing parent ID returns nil for the
  association instead of making a bogus remote call. ([#68](https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/68), [Javier Saldana](https://github.com/jassa))
-   A `has_many` association does not trigger a remote call if parent is a new
  record. ([#97](https://github.com/rails/activeresource/pull/97), [Sasha Shamne](https://github.com/shamne))
